title: Thai Chicken Meatball Soup
text:
4” piece ginger
6 garlic cloves
1 jalapeño
1kg ground chicken
1 large bunch cilantro, leaves and stems finely chopped, a few whole leaves reserved for serving
3 tbsp fish sauce
2 tbsp vegetable oil
500ml chicken broth
14oz can full-fat coconut milk
1/2 tsp granulated sugar
140g baby spinach
1 tbsp lime juice, plus wedges for serving
Rice, for serving

title: Thai Chicken Meatball Soup
text:
1

Cook rice
Finely chop leaves and steams of cilantro, leaving a few leaves for serving
Microplane ginger, garlic and jalapeño (or finely chop them by hand)
Transfer half to a large bowl and set the rest aside
To the large bowl, add the chicken, finely chopped cilantro, 2 tbsp fish sauce and 1 tsp salt
Use your hands to fully combine but do not overmix

title: Thai Chicken Meatball Soup
text:
2

Use your hands or spoon to form 2-inch meatballs (2oz)
In a large Dutch oven or pot, heat the oil over medium heat
Working in batches, add the meatballs in a single layer and cook, flipping halfway through, until golden brown on two sides, 5-8 minutes
Transfer to a plate and repeat, adding oil as needed

title: Thai Chicken Meatball Soup
text:
3

Once meatballs are browned and out of the pot, if the oil is burned, wipe it out and add a bit more to the pot
Reduce the heat a bit, add the reserved ginger mixture and sauté until fragrant, about 1 minute
Add the chicken broth, coconut milk, sugar and the remaining 1 tablespoon fish sauce, and bring to a simmer
Add the meatballs and any juices from the plate, and simmer until the flavors come together and the meatballs are cooked through, 5-8 minutes

title: Thai Chicken Meatball Soup
text:
4

Remove from heat, and stir in the spinach and lime juice
Divide rice among bowls, then top with meatballs, broth and cilantro
Serve with lime wedges

title: Chimichurri Chicken
text:
1

Make the sauce: On a cutting board, smash and coarsely chop the garlic with 0.5 tsp salt
Mash the mixture using the side of your knife until a coarse paste forms
Move the paste to the side of the cutting board, then chop the parsley and oregano together with the remaining 1 tsp salt
Combine the garlic paste and the chopped herbs and chop and mash until the herbs are bruised and fragrant

title: Chimichurri Chicken
text:
2

Transfer to a medium bowl
Add the red-pepper flakes, black pepper, vinegar and extra-virgin olive oil; stir to combine
You should have about 0.75 cup chimichurri. It can be prepared in advance and refrigerated in an airtight container up to 2 days

title: Chimichurri Chicken
text:
3

Make the chicken: Pat the chicken dry. If thickness varies greatly, pound to an even thickness, about 0.5 inch

You could also refrigerate overnight; just let it come to room temperature before cooking

title: Chimichurri Chicken
text:
4

text:

title: Shrimp Scampi With Orzo
text:
1 lb large shrimp, peeled and deveined
3 tbsp extra-virgin olive oil
1 tbsp lemon zest
1 tbsp lemon juice
0.5 tsp red-pepper flakes
Salt
Pepper
4 garlic cloves
2 tbsp unsalted butter
1 cup orzo
1/3 cup dry white wine
2 cups boiling water, seafood stock or chicken stock
3tbsp finely chopped parsley

title: Shrimp Scampi With Orzo
text:
1

In a medium bowl, stir together shrimp, 1 tbsp olive oil, lemon zest, red-pepper flakes, 0.5 tsp salt, 0.75 tsp pepper and half of the garlic
Set aside to marinate (1 hour)

title: Shrimp Scampi With Orzo
text:
2

Add butter, remaining olive oil and remaining garlic to a medium skillet set over medium heat
When the butter starts to bubble, add the orzo and 0.5 tsp salt and cook, stirring often, until the orzo is toasted, about 2 minutes, adjusting the heat as necessary to prevent the garlic from burning
Carefully add the wine — it will bubble — and stir until absorbed, about 1 minute
Stir in water, reduce heat to low, cover, and cook until orzo is al dente, about 12 minutes

title: Shrimp Scampi With Orzo
text:
3

Add the shrimp in a snug, even layer on top of the orzo, cover, and cook until all the shrimp is pink and cooked through, 2 to 4 minutes
Remove from heat and let sit, covered, 2 minutes

title: Shrimp Scampi With Orzo
text:
4

Sprinkle with parsley and lemon juice, season with salt and pepper, and serve immediately

text:

1 lemon
6 to 8 chicken thighs (about 3 pounds), patted dry
Chopped fresh parsley, for serving (optional)

title: Baked Chicken Thighs
text:
1

In a large bowl, combine the olive oil, garlic, mustard, thyme, salt and pepper
Zest the lemon over the bowl, reserving the rest of the lemon for serving, and whisk until combined

title: Baked Chicken Thighs
text:
2

Add the chicken thighs to the bowl, tossing until fully coated in the marinade
Cover and let marinate for 30 minutes at room temperature, or up to 12 hours in the refrigerator

title: Baked Chicken Thighs
text:
3

Heat the oven to 425 degrees and lift the chicken thighs from the marinade, letting any excess drip into the bowl
Place the thighs on a sheet pan and let them sit at room temperature while the oven heats
Bake until fully cooked and lightly browned, 25 to 30 minutes
An internal thermometer inserted into the thickest part of the meat should read 165 to 175 degrees

title: Baked Chicken Thighs

4

Cut the lemon in half and squeeze over the chicken

title: Blackened Chicken Breasts
text:
1

Make the blackening seasoning: In a small bowl, combine the salt, smoked paprika, thyme, oregano, garlic powder, onion powder, mustard powder and cayenne

title: Blackened Chicken Breasts
text:

Carefully slice the chicken breasts horizontally in half, then pat dry with a paper towel

title: Blackened Chicken Breasts
text:

Drizzle oil into a large skillet or cast iron pan over medium-high
When the oil begins to shimmer, carefully place the chicken in the pan and cook undisturbed for 5 minutes
Watch out for any oil splattering and popping out of the pan
Cook until the seasoning literally darkens
After 5 minutes, flip the chicken and cook for another 3 minutes

title: Blackened Chicken Breasts

text:

1 pound loose sweet Italian sausage or sausage links, casings removed
1 medium white or yellow onion, diced
6 garlic cloves, minced
1 tsp paprika
½ tsp dried fennel seeds
Salt and black pepper
Crushed red pepper
2 tbsps tomato paste
1 (28-ounce) can tomato purée
8 cups (64 ounces) vegetable or chicken stock
1 (9- to 10-ounce) package refrigerated or frozen cheese tortellini
1¼ cups heavy cream

title: Creamy Tortellini Soup
text:
1 - Cook Sausage

Heat the olive oil in a large pot or Dutch oven over medium-high
Add the sausage and cook, breaking it up with a spoon as you go, until it is browned, 5 to 9 minutes
Push the sausage to one side of the pot and spoon out any excess grease, leaving about 2 tbsp behind

title: Creamy Tortellini Soup
text:
2

Adjust heat to medium, then add:

onion
garlic
paprika
fennel
1.5 tsp each salt and black pepper,
Pinch of crushed red pepper

Cook, stirring, for 2 minutes, until the onion is just softened and everything is fragrant
Add the tomato paste and cook, stirring, until it darkens, 2 to 3 minutes
Adjust heat to high, stir in tomato purée and stock, cover the pot and bring to a gentle boil, then add the tortellini and cook until tender, 2 to 3 minutes (1 minute longer if frozen)

title: Creamy Tortellini Soup
text:
3

Remove from heat and add the lemon juice
Stir to incorporate, then taste and season with salt and pepper as needed

title: Creamy Tortellini Soup

4

Serve warm topped with plenty of grated Parmesan

text:

For the rest of the dish: - 2-3 bunches green onions - 1/3 cup neutral oil (such as vegetable, canola, or avocado oil) - 15 g rock sugar (or substitute 1 tbsp granulated sugar for 15g rock sugar) - 1 1/4-1 1/2 cups water (use less water if your stove has lower BTUs, or more if your stove is very hot) - 2 tablespoons light soy sauce - 1 1/2 tablespoons dark soy sauce

title: Braised Pork Chops, Shanghai-style
text:
1

For each pork chop, cut 2 small slits along the pork fat on the outer perimeter of the chop to prevent it from curling up during the cooking process
Then pound it front and back using the back of your knife (or a meat tenderizer), until the chops are between ¼ and ½ inch thick (about 0.75cm)
This is an important step
Take your time to do it thoroughly

title: Braised Pork Chops, Shanghai-style
text:
2

Mix the pork chops with the Shaoxing wine, salt, light soy sauce, and water, using your hands to toss the chops until they absorb all the liquid

title: Braised Pork Chops, Shanghai-style
text:
3

Add 2 medium eggs, and mix until everything is well absorbed and the chops are uniformly coated in egg
Finally, add the cornstarch and mix everything well one more time
Marinate for 15 minutes

title: Braised Pork Chops, Shanghai-style
text:
4

Wash the scallions and pat them thoroughly dry with a kitchen towel to prevent splattering in the wok later
Cut them in half crosswise
If the stems are particularly thick, you can also cut them in half lengthwise.

title: Braised Pork Chops, Shanghai-style
text:
5

Preheat your wok over medium-high heat until it starts to smoke
Coat the bottom of the wok with 1/3 cup of oil
Test the oil temperature by sticking a chopstick in the oil
A stream of small bubbles means the oil is hot enough to cook the chops
Add the pork chops in two batches, cooking each side for 30 seconds to 1 minute, until the pork chops are a light golden color and the coating is set
Avoid over-frying, or the meat will become tough
Transfer to a plate

title: Braised Pork Chops, Shanghai-style
text:
6

There should be some oil left in the wok
If not, add a couple tablespoons
Over medium heat, add the scallions
Cook for a few minutes until they are wilted and lightly browned around the edges

title: Braised Pork Chops, Shanghai-style
text:

Place the pork chops on top of the bed of scallions
Add the rock sugar, water, light soy sauce, and dark soy sauce. With the heat still at medium, cover and simmer for about 3 minutes

title: Braised Pork Chops, Shanghai-style
text:
8

Remove the lid, flip the pork chops, and submerge them under the sauce
Cover and simmer for another 2-3 minutes

title: Braised Pork Chops, Shanghai-style
text:
9

Remove the cover, and increase the heat to high
Stir everything well one more time, and quickly transfer all of the pork chops to a serving platter

title: Braised Pork Chops, Shanghai-style
text:
10

Let the sauce thicken, cooking for 1-2 minutes, stirring occasionally with your wok spatula and letting it turn glossy and thick enough to coat the spatula
You will still want some sauce to mix with your rice, so don’t reduce it too much!

title: Braised Pork Chops, Shanghai-style

Spread the scallions over the pork chops, and pour the sauce over the whole thing
Serve!

1 small bunch scallions, whites and greens separated, sliced
4 cups shredded cabbage (from about half small head)
Salt
4 garlic cloves, minced
6 cups cooked rice, white or brown, preferably day-old
2.5 tbsp fish sauce
0.5 tbsp soy sauce
0.5 cup kimchi, drained and chopped, plus more for serving if you like
0.5 cup green peas (thawed, if frozen)
4 fried eggs, for serving (optional)
Toasted sesame oil, for drizzling (optional)

title: Crispy Fried Rice With Bacon and Cabbage
text:
1

In a large nonstick skillet or wok over medium-high, heat 2 tbsp oil until almost smoking
Stir in bacon, and cook, stirring constantly, until bacon is golden, about 2 minutes
Transfer to a heatproof bowl, leaving as much oil in the skillet as you can

title: Crispy Fried Rice With Bacon and Cabbage
text:
2

Add scallion whites to the pan
Cook until soft, stirring frequently, 1 to 2 minutes
If the pan looks dry, drizzle in a little more oil, then stir in cabbage and a pinch of salt
Cook, continuing to stir frequently, until cabbage is soft, 2 to 4 minutes
Stir in garlic, and cook until fragrant, another 1 to 2 minutes
Transfer to the bowl with the bacon

title: Crispy Fried Rice With Bacon and Cabbage
text:
3

Add remaining 3 tbsps oil to skillet and raise heat to high
Add rice, and a large pinch of salt, then toss thoroughly to coat with oil
Spread out rice in an even layer along the bottom (and sides if in a wok), and drizzle fish sauce and soy sauce over
Let rice sit until sizzling stops and it starts to crackle and crisp, 1 to 4 minutes
Toss, taste, and add more fish sauce or soy sauce if necessary

title: Crispy Fried Rice With Bacon and Cabbage
text:
4

Fold in bacon mixture, kimchi and peas, then transfer to plates
Top with scallion greens, more kimchi to taste, and fried eggs, if using
Drizzle everything with sesame oil and soy sauce, if you like, and serve immediately

title: Sticky Miso Salmon Bowl
text:
2 cups sushi rice
3 tbsp white miso
2 tbsp honey
1 tbsp vegetable oil
1 tbsp freshly grated ginger
2 teaspoons fresh grapefruit zest plus 1 tbsp juice
4 x 6-8oz skinless salmon fillets, patted dry
Salt and pepper
4 green onions, thinly sliced
1 tbsp unsalted butter, cubed
Any combination of kimchi, chile crisp, toasted nori sheets, and sliced cucumber, avocado or radish, for serving

title: Sticky Miso Salmon Bowl
text:
1

Put the rice in a medium bowl and fill with cool tap water
Run your fingers through the rice, gently swooshing the grains around to loosen the starch
Dump out as much water as you can and repeat until the water runs slightly more clear, another two to three rinses

title: Sticky Miso Salmon Bowl
text:
2

Drain the rice and transfer to a small or medium saucepan that has a tight-fitting lid
Pour in 2.25 cups cool water and bring to a boil over medium-high
Give the rice a stir to help keep it from sticking to the bottom of the pot, then cover and decrease heat to low
Cook without lifting the lid for 18 minutes
Set your timer!

title: Sticky Miso Salmon Bowl
text:
3

While the rice is cooking, place a rack about 5 inches from the broiler heat source and set the broiler to high
Whisk the miso, honey, oil, ginger and grapefruit zest and juice in a large bowl
Season the salmon lightly with salt and add to the bowl
Gently toss to coat
Marinate at room temperature until the timer for the rice goes off

title: Sticky Miso Salmon Bowl
text:
4

Remove the pot of rice from the heat and let steam, covered, for 10 minutes, while you cook the salmon

title: Sticky Miso Salmon Bowl
text:
5

Using tongs, arrange the salmon on a foil-lined rimmed sheet tray
Make sure to leave the marinade on and spread any excess on top of the fillets. (This step will make for better browning
Broil the salmon until glossy and charred in most spots, about 5 minutes for medium-rare or 7 minutes for medium
Your timing will also depend on whether or not you’d like a little char on top

title: Sticky Miso Salmon Bowl
text:
6

Uncover the rice and add the scallions and butter
Season with salt and several grinds of pepper
Fluff the rice with a rubber spatula until each grain is coated
Serve the salmon over the rice and add any of the toppings you desire

title: Blackened Chicken Breasts
text:
1 tbsp kosher salt
1 tbsp smoked paprika
0.5 tbsp dried thyme
0.5 tbsp dried oregano
0.5 tbsp garlic powder
0.5 tbsp onion powder
1 teaspoon mustard powder
1 teaspoon ground cayenne
2 chicken breasts, 1.5 to 2 pounds, room temp
2 tbsp vegetable oil

title: Blackened Chicken Breasts
text:
1

Make the blackening seasoning: In a small bowl, combine the salt, smoked paprika, thyme, oregano, garlic powder, onion powder, mustard powder and cayenne

title: Blackened Chicken Breasts
text:
2

Carefully slice the chicken breasts horizontally in half, then pat dry with a paper towel
Thoroughly coat all sides with the blackening seasoning and set aside

title: Blackened Chicken Breasts
text:
3

Drizzle oil into a large skillet or cast iron pan over medium-high
When the oil begins to shimmer, carefully place the chicken in the pan and cook undisturbed for 5 minutes
Watch out for any oil splattering and popping out of the pan
Cook until the seasoning literally darkens
After 5 minutes, flip the chicken and cook for another 3 minutes

title: Blackened Chicken Breasts
text:
4

Turn off the heat and leave the pan tented with aluminum foil for 5 minutes (this will help the chicken continue cooking from the residual heat without drying out)
Remove the foil, then let the chicken rest for at least 2 minutes

title: Blackened Chicken Breasts
text:
5

When ready to serve, slice the chicken into 0.5-inch pieces. Serve immediately

title: Chimichurri Chicken
text:
1

Make the sauce: On a cutting board, smash and coarsely chop the garlic with 0.5 tsp salt
Mash the mixture using the side of your knife until a coarse paste forms
Move the paste to the side of the cutting board, then chop the parsley and oregano together with the remaining 1 tsp salt
Combine the garlic paste and the chopped herbs and chop and mash until the herbs are bruised and fragrant

title: Chimichurri Chicken
text:
2

Transfer to a medium bowl
Add the red-pepper flakes, black pepper, vinegar and extra-virgin olive oil; stir to combine
You should have about 0.75 cup chimichurri. It can be prepared in advance and refrigerated in an airtight container up to 2 days

title: Chimichurri Chicken
text:
3

Make the chicken: Pat the chicken dry. If thickness varies greatly, pound to an even thickness, about 0.5 inch
Rub half the chimichurri all over the chicken and let sit for at least 10 minutes
You could also refrigerate overnight; just let it come to room temperature before cooking

title: Chimichurri Chicken
text:
4

Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high
Wipe off excess marinade from the chicken and cook until juices run clear, about 5 minutes per side for thighs and 4 minutes per side for breasts
For grilling and oven instructions, see Tips below

title: Chimichurri Chicken
text:
5

Serve with remaining chimichurri spooned over top

title: Chimichurri Chicken
text:
Tips

Oven instructions: Heat oven to 425 degrees. Oil a foil-lined baking sheet, then add the chicken and roast until cooked through and juices run clear, 15 to 20 minutes
Grilling instructions: Heat a grill to medium-high. Oil the grates. Wipe off excess marinade from the chicken, then grill over direct heat until cooked through and juices run clear, about 5 minutes per side for thighs and about 3 minutes per side for breasts

title: Chicken Noodle Soup
text:
2 tbsp unsalted butter
1 medium yellow onion, finely chopped
Salt and black pepper
8 cups chicken stock
2 bay leaves or thyme sprigs (or 1 teaspoon dried thyme)
0.25 cup finely chopped parsley or dill, stems reserved, plus more for garnish
2 medium carrots, cut into 0.5-inch pieces
2 celery stalks, cut into 0.5-inch pieces
6 ounces dried noodles, such as egg noodles or short pasta
3 cups shredded, cooked chicken (from 1 rotisserie chicken)

title: Chicken Noodle Soup
text:
1

In a large pot or Dutch oven, melt the butter over medium
Add the onion, season with salt and pepper, and cook until softened but not browned, 5 to 7 minutes

title: Chicken Noodle Soup
text:
2

Add the chicken stock, bay leaves and herb stems and bring to a boil over high
Add the carrots, celery and noodles and cook, uncovered, over medium-high until the pasta is al dente according to package directions, 7 to 10 minutes
Add the chicken and simmer just until warmed, 1 to 2 minutes
Pluck out the bay leaves and herb stems, stir in the chopped parsley, and season to taste with salt and pepper
